description.narrative: National Office of Lukuatim Pikinini and Provincial DFCD has the capacity* to lead, roll out and monitor implementation of Lukautim Pikinini Act (LPA) at national and sub-national level by 2017,which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection Systems, Data And Child Protection, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, children at risk of violence, exploitation and abuse have increased access to prevention and intervention services for protection and justice.

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Papua New Guinea United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Papua New Guinea Country Programme Document 2018-2022
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Papua New Guinea 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Papua New Guinea 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Papua New Guinea 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National Office of Lukuatim Pikinini and Provincial DFCD has the capacity* to lead, roll out and monitor implementation of Lukautim Pikinini Act (LPA) at national and sub-national level by 2017

description.narrative: The National Child Protection Policy (2017-2027) was endorsed and launched; and government allocated USD 950,000 for its implementation in 2018. A total of 173 child protection officers were trained and given delegated authority to preform duties under the Child Protection Act. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: # of provinces with functional child protection register

actual.value: 2017:0, A provision for establishment of child protection register reflected in the Child Protection Act and Child Protection Policy. Readiness assessment for establishment of Child Protection Information System Completed but system not established

title.narrative: # of child and family service councils established & functional

actual.value: 2017:0, Weak leadership within the office of child and family services resulted in delay in achievement of this result

title.narrative: # of provinces with at least two trained and gazetted CPOs

actual.value: 2017:15, provinces have at least 2 trained CPOs who received delegated power from the Director of CFS Office to perform their mandate

title.narrative: # of child protection, policies, standards, guidelines and planning initiatives submitted for endorsement to relevant agencies

actual.value: 2017:9, Two laws (Juvenile Justice Act & Child Protection Act) enacted by parliament Two regulatory framework (National Child Protection policy and Child Protection Regulation endorsed by National Executive Council Five regulatory frameworks developed.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Justice system complies with the minimum standards laid down in the Beijing Rules of Justice
